mdRecord.dcterms:title: Norfolk Borough, April 24, 1838: Sir: At a recent meeting of the people of this Borough, resolutions were adopted by them, respectfully recommending to their fellow citizens of Virginia and North Carolina to unite with them in a Convention, to be holden in the city of Richmond on the second Wednesday in June next, with a view to aid in the attainment of the objects specified in the report and resolutions adopted at the last session of the Augusta Convention. : .. we have been appointed a committee to correspond with the counties and towns in those states, and to extend to them a most respectful and earnest invitation to meet us / John S. Millson, John N. Tazewell, Hugh B. Grigsby, Myer Myers, James T. Soutter, Joseph T. Allyn, John H. Butler.
Proceedings of the citizens of Norfolk Borough on the subject of the Southern Commercial Convention
Sir At a recent meeting of the people of this Borough
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: King, Miles.
Millson, John S. (John Singleton), 1808-1874
Norfolk (Va.). Mayor.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Printed on p. [1]-[2]; p. [3]-[4] are blank.

Includes "Proceedings of the citizens of Norfolk Borough on the subject of the Southern Commercial Convention," April 19th, 1838 and a report of the "Meeting of the General Committee," held on April 20th. Both reports are signed (in print) by M. King.

Addressed on p. [4] to James McDowell Esqr., Rockbridge, and postmarked Norfolk Va. May 3. Handwritten docket title: 1838. Com. of Citizens of Norfolk Co's Letter - Ja. McDowell. Concerning a Southern Commercial Convention.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Tracy W. McGregor Library. McGregor Fund Purchase, 1996.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Commercial associations--Southern States
Southern States--Commerce
